conbody.p: A business type qualifies model attributes with a comprehensive business meaning.
For instance, an attribute based on the business type Amount has a clear business meaning, whereas one based on the simple primitive type decimal has none.

A business type has display properties that the Page Designer retrieves when attributes are dragged and dropped into the page editor. This brings productivity and consistency to the front-end design. For instance, if you create a module displaying an attribute of type Amount, the page designer retrieves the precisions and scale from the business type's constraint on decimal property.

This concept exists in Triple'A Plus Core. All Triple'A Plus Core business types are delivered with the Triple'A Plus Web packaging project because they are required by the meta-dictionary and formats importation.
conbody.note: Changes made on properties of existing business types, such as constraints on string or decimal, are not automatically reported to models using attributes based on such business types. For instance, if you reduce the total digits of the business type Amount, the existing modules displaying Amounts are not impacted. Only further drops of attributes based on the business type Amounts will use the new properties values.
